content.description: Climbs a clean brown slab with zero protection - toprope or solo.
content.location:
This is the face just left of

Marked Card

, and sta

rts from a ledge above the finish of

Exfoliation Confrontation

.

To descend from the top head west to access anchors atop

Hang 'em High

or down-climb

Watering Hole

.

content.description: This prominent chimney divides the left and right sides of the Corral Wall and while an easy lead is perhaps most useful as a casual down-climb from the top of the wall.
content.location:
The obvious chimney left of

Hang 'em High

.

content.description:
Line halfway between Exfoliation Confrontation and Pony Express.

2 bolts on the lower wall: start up crack (bolt) then move up and right (bolt) and up to huge ledge. A bit runout. 5.10.

1 bolt under the juggy roof above the ledge

Finish either near Exfoliation Confrontation rap rings, or head up the huge dihedral (thin/brass, 5.9) to trad anchor and easy downclimb to E.C. rap rings.

Button head bolts in ok condition.

Anyone know the name etc.?
content.location: Line with 2 bolts, starting at the left-slanting crack and heading up and right

content.description: Approach from ground level by tunneling behind some blocks and then continue up the smooth face above passing one bolt down low. The crux moves are well protected but higher a fall will land you on boulders, so don't fall!
content.protection: One bolt (3/8"), gear to 2.5 inches for the belay
content.location: Located on the smooth face just right of ??.

climbs.name: Riding Shotgun
climbs.fa: Geoff Archer and Alan Bartlett, November 1990

content.description: Tunnel up through boulders at the base to reach the corner and climb the face to the right on featured varnish until it ends and slab it to the top.
content.location:
Just left of

Shotgun Wedding

and high on the face is this varnished right facing corner without a crack.

content.description:
Climb juggy rock down low past 2 bolts follow crack/arete system to anchor. Start watching for anchors on right wall or you can climb right past them (keep moving up and right after the slanting crack system, the anchors are on a sort of fin around to the right - not straight up).

Warning: Watch out for a bee hive in a hole/slot left from the anchor. VERY active on warm days (which are often at Corral Wall).
content.protection: 2 bolts down low.  Possible gear further up but seems unnecessary as it's low angle and well featured.  Two bolt anchor with rap rings located on right hand wall (shares with "Czech Crack")
content.location:
This route can be found 50 feet right of

Exfoliation Confrontation

or just left of

Czech Crack

.

content.description: Climb the arÃªte to the left of Exfoliation Confrontation, staying out (right) of the chimney.
content.location: Start to the left of Exfoliation Confrontation and just to the right of a chimney.

content.description: This climbs the crack to groove between the two face routes on the left side of the wall.
content.location:
Between

Hang 'em High

and

High Noon

.

content.description: This fun route climbs a groove/chimney to a small overhang then cuts left and finishes up a somewhat loose plated face to the top of the wall.
content.location:
Between

Shotgun Wedding

and

The Onion

.

climbs.name: High Noon
climbs.fa: Louie Anderson, Geoff Archer & Ripley Casdorph, February 1990

content.description: A couple of moves lead to a short crack down low, followed by slabby face crossing a couple of horizontal breaks. The crux is in the lower section and protectable. The 'R' is for the top section that is a much easier bolt-protected slab/face.
content.protection: Pro to hand sized, two bolts protect the upper half. Continue back from the topout about 10' to a two bolt anchor/rap station on the wall above the topout ledge.
content.location:
A few yards left of

Exfoliation Confrontation

(5.9) and just right of (finishing to the same anchors as) Hang Em High. Identifiable by the two well-spaced bolts up high.

content.description: This prominent left facing corner with dark brown rock offers scant protection if leading.
content.location:
Starts from a ledge above the finish of

Exfoliation Confrontation

.

To descend from the top head west to access anchors atop

Hang 'em High

or down-climb

Watering Hole

.

content.description: Start on top of large boulder to easily clip first bolt.  Follow bolts past horizontals.  Anchor up and behind, plan to belay from the top or ruin your cord.  Decent via rap (climbers left) into a blocky gully.
content.protection: 3 bolts to 2 bolt anchor with rings.
content.location: Furthest left route on right wall.  Directly next to "High Noon".

content.description:
This is a fun and juggy route. There were a few decently protected cruxes where smaller holds had to be used, but all in all it was sinker holds. This was in sharp contrast to most of my "smearing" J-Tree experiences. It was more like climbing Southeastern sandstone!

This climb is on the right-hand portion of the Corral Wall, towards the left end of that side. Climb a dark wall with a few bolts and huge, apparent juggy holds, eventually going up and right into a light section of rock to finish at a 2 bolt anchor.

Rap to the ground with a 60 meter rope to descend.
content.protection: 4 bolts, 2 bolt anchor/rap and maybe a few slings on chicken heads. The lead is heady, but probably not dangerous. The runouts are on easier ground and non-threatening if you don't go tearing off holds.

climbs.name: Czech Crack
climbs.fa: Jiri Vodrazka, Peter Tuzil, Geoff Archer & Al Bartlett - December 1990

content.description: Start in black finger crack & climb through bulge.  Continue up easy ground to anchors.
content.protection: Medium nuts to 4" cams - 2 bolt anchor with rings shares with "Pony Express"
content.location: Directly right of "Pony Express" starting in finger crack.

content.description: This is, at this time, the first route on the right side of the Corral Wall. It's located about twenty-five feet in from the notch. Begin on easy rock about twenty feet or so to the right of the Czech crack. Climb up and left to a ledge. Climb the face past two bolts. There will be a third bolt protecting the final face climbing above.
